item.title: ....adf
item.dc:creator: @Efilite Efilite
item.description:
@Efilite wrote:

[quote=“Taharok, post:11, topic:249312”][quote author=Efilite link=topic=328608.msg2573983#msg2573983 date=1228855154]
“Well since that f**king noob (not posting name)”

Was this noob me by any chance?
If not okay.
If so, Caesar Cipher is used in mostly everything that is corrupted. The code that you are doing IS A CAESAR CIPHER
The code I posted was just a example, a quick one that probably wouldn’t even work.
[/quote]

Wrong: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Caesar_cipher

A Caesar cipher is a replication of how Julius Caesar talked to his generals. It is a simple shift of plain text letters down the alphabet and would probably be exceptionally easy to crack.[/quote]I’m wrong then, but it’s pretty much the same thing.

item.title: ....adf
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Moparisthebest:

Why not just use SSL? It’s impossible to crack (unless you are the NSA or something…)

Because SSL/TLS isn’t a method of encryption strings, it’s a protocol which makes use of other string encryption algos.
